comment:
Base Converter to convert JSON to VoltScript datatype or object and vice versa.
This is an abstract class only, a derived class must be used.
commentblock: &lt;div class=&quot;description&quot;&gt;	&lt;ul class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;		&lt;li class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;			&lt;div class=&quot;comments&quot;&gt;&lt;!-- comment --&gt;&lt;pre&gt;Base Converter to convert JSON to VoltScript datatype or object and vice versa.&lt;br /&gt;This is an abstract class only, a derived class must be used.&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;			&lt;hr /&gt;		&lt;/li&gt;	&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
commenthtml: Base Converter to convert JSON to VoltScript datatype or object and vice versa.&lt;br /&gt;This is an abstract class only, a derived class must be used.

methods.label: fromJson
methods.comment: Main function to convert JSON value to VltScript value. Needs to be overridden in derived class.
methods.signature: Function fromJson(fromJson As JsonObject) As Variant
methods.commentblock: &lt;div class=&quot;description&quot;&gt;	&lt;ul class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;		&lt;li class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;			&lt;div class=&quot;comments&quot;&gt;&lt;!-- comment --&gt;&lt;pre&gt;Main function to convert JSON value to VltScript value. Needs to be overridden in derived class.&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;			&lt;hr /&gt;		&lt;/li&gt;	&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
methods.commenthtml: Main function to convert JSON value to VltScript value. Needs to be overridden in derived class.

methods.label: serialize
methods.comment: Serializes a VoltScript value into a JSON object.
methods.signature: Sub serialize(source As Variant, target As JsonObject)
methods.commentblock: &lt;div class=&quot;description&quot;&gt;	&lt;ul class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;		&lt;li class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;			&lt;div class=&quot;comments&quot;&gt;&lt;!-- comment --&gt;&lt;pre&gt;Serializes a VoltScript value into a JSON object.&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;			&lt;hr /&gt;		&lt;/li&gt;	&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
methods.commenthtml: Serializes a VoltScript value into a JSON object.

arguments.label: source
arguments.comment: VoltScript object from which to serialize
arguments.commenthtml: VoltScript object from which to serialize

methods.label: toJson
methods.comment: Main function to convert VoltScript value to JSON value. Needs to be overridden in derived class.
methods.signature: Function toJson(source As Variant) As Variant
methods.commentblock: &lt;div class=&quot;description&quot;&gt;	&lt;ul class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;		&lt;li class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;			&lt;div class=&quot;comments&quot;&gt;&lt;!-- comment --&gt;&lt;pre&gt;Main function to convert VoltScript value to JSON value. Needs to be overridden in derived class.&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;			&lt;hr /&gt;		&lt;/li&gt;	&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
methods.commenthtml: Main function to convert VoltScript value to JSON value. Needs to be overridden in derived class.

arguments.label: source
arguments.comment: Variant containing the propery to be serialized
arguments.commentblock: &lt;div class=&quot;description&quot;&gt;	&lt;ul class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;		&lt;li class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;			&lt;div class=&quot;comments&quot;&gt;&lt;!-- comment --&gt;&lt;pre&gt;Variant containing the propery to be serialized&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;			&lt;hr /&gt;		&lt;/li&gt;	&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
arguments.commenthtml: Variant containing the propery to be serialized

methods.label: deserialize
methods.comment: Deserializes a JSON object into a property in a holder object
methods.signature: Sub deserialize(holder As JsonConversionHelper, source As JsonObject)
methods.commentblock: &lt;div class=&quot;description&quot;&gt;	&lt;ul class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;		&lt;li class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;			&lt;div class=&quot;comments&quot;&gt;&lt;!-- comment --&gt;&lt;pre&gt;Deserializes a JSON object into a property in a holder object&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;			&lt;hr /&gt;		&lt;/li&gt;	&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
methods.commenthtml: Deserializes a JSON object into a property in a holder object

methods.label: getMeTypeForDebug
methods.comment: Creates a prefix for debug messages
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code can be included in a base class&apos;s method. TypeName() will be called on the current object. So if debug is enabled, a message will be written that makes it clear which derived class&apos;s fromJson() method is being called.
%END REM
Call DebugPrint_Samsara(&quot;Entering &quot; & Me.getMeTypeForDebug & &quot;.fromJson&quot;)
methods.commenthtml: Creates a prefix for debug messages
methods.codesamplehtml: %REM&lt;br /&gt;The following code can be included in a base class&apos;s method. TypeName() will be called on the current object. So if debug is enabled, a message will be written that makes it clear which derived class&apos;s fromJson() method is being called.&lt;br /&gt;%END REM&lt;br /&gt;Call DebugPrint_Samsara(&quot;Entering &quot; & Me.getMeTypeForDebug & &quot;.fromJson&quot;)

methods.label: cleanup
methods.codesample:
%REM
Runs an execute statement, which needs global variables to store the value and the object from which to extract it. Whether successful or unsoccessful, the Finally block&apos;s call to cleanup() sub re-initialises samsaraObj, samsaraVal and samsaraParamVals to empty variants.
%END REM
Try
    execString = |samsaraVal = samsaraObj.| & propName
    Execute(execString)
Catch
    Error 1400, &quot;Unable to set &quot; & labelName & &quot; to extracted value&quot;
Finally
    Call Me.cleanup()
End Try
methods.codesamplehtml: %REM&lt;br /&gt;Runs an execute statement, which needs global variables to store the value and the object from which to extract it. Whether successful or unsoccessful, the Finally block&apos;s call to cleanup() sub re-initialises samsaraObj, samsaraVal and samsaraParamVals to empty variants.&lt;br /&gt;%END REM&lt;br /&gt;Try&lt;br /&gt;    execString = |samsaraVal = samsaraObj.| & propName&lt;br /&gt;    Execute(execString)&lt;br /&gt;Catch&lt;br /&gt;    Error 1400, &quot;Unable to set &quot; & labelName & &quot; to extracted value&quot;&lt;br /&gt;Finally&lt;br /&gt;    Call Me.cleanup()&lt;br /&gt;End Try

methods.label: isReturnObj
methods.comment:
Whether or not the converter returns a VoltScript object or VoltScript scalar or scalar array.
This function is used to determine whether &quot;Set&quot; needs to be used to write the result to a variable.
Default version of the function returns True.
methods.codesample:
%REM
A converter is expected to know whether it should return a scalar or a VoltScript object. The default is false, that it only returns scalars. This function is used to determine whether or not there is a need to call Set. In future versions, where Return is implemented in functions, this may no longer be required.
%END REM
Dim returnVal as Variant
If Me.isReturnObj Then
    Set returnVal = Me.fromJson(jsonObj)
Else
    returnVal = Me.fromJson(jsonObj)
End If
methods.commentblock: &lt;div class=&quot;description&quot;&gt;	&lt;ul class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;		&lt;li class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;			&lt;div class=&quot;comments&quot;&gt;&lt;!-- comment --&gt;&lt;pre&gt;Whether or not the converter returns a VoltScript object or VoltScript scalar or scalar array.&lt;br /&gt;This function is used to determine whether &quot;Set&quot; needs to be used to write the result to a variable.&lt;br /&gt;Default version of the function returns True.&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;			&lt;hr /&gt;		&lt;/li&gt;	&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
methods.commenthtml: Whether or not the converter returns a VoltScript object or VoltScript scalar or scalar array.&lt;br /&gt;This function is used to determine whether &quot;Set&quot; needs to be used to write the result to a variable.&lt;br /&gt;Default version of the function returns True.
methods.codesamplehtml: %REM&lt;br /&gt;A converter is expected to know whether it should return a scalar or a VoltScript object. The default is false, that it only returns scalars. This function is used to determine whether or not there is a need to call Set. In future versions, where Return is implemented in functions, this may no longer be required.&lt;br /&gt;%END REM&lt;br /&gt;Dim returnVal as Variant&lt;br /&gt;If Me.isReturnObj Then&lt;br /&gt;    Set returnVal = Me.fromJson(jsonObj)&lt;br /&gt;Else&lt;br /&gt;    returnVal = Me.fromJson(jsonObj)&lt;br /&gt;End If

methods.label: forPropertyName
methods.comment:
Defines a custom property name from the relevant Class to use.
If not used, the code will look for a property that matches the label in the JSON
methods.codesample:
%REM
Ensures that when the surnameConverter extracts its value, it writes it to the lastName property of the target VoltScript object.
%END REM
Dim surnameConverter as New JsonScalarConverter
Call surnameConverter.forPropertyName(&quot;lastName&quot;)
methods.signature: Function forPropertyName(propertyName As String) As AbstractJsonConverter
methods.commentblock: &lt;div class=&quot;description&quot;&gt;	&lt;ul class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;		&lt;li class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;			&lt;div class=&quot;comments&quot;&gt;&lt;!-- comment --&gt;&lt;pre&gt;Defines a custom property name from the relevant Class to use.&lt;br /&gt;If not used, the code will look for a property that matches the label in the JSON&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;			&lt;hr /&gt;		&lt;/li&gt;	&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
methods.commenthtml: Defines a custom property name from the relevant Class to use.&lt;br /&gt;If not used, the code will look for a property that matches the label in the JSON
methods.codesamplehtml: %REM&lt;br /&gt;Ensures that when the surnameConverter extracts its value, it writes it to the lastName property of the target VoltScript object.&lt;br /&gt;%END REM&lt;br /&gt;Dim surnameConverter as New JsonScalarConverter&lt;br /&gt;Call surnameConverter.forPropertyName(&quot;lastName&quot;)

arguments.label: propertyName
arguments.comment: Property name to look for in the relevant Class. E.g. if the JSON has a label &quot;lastName&quot; but your class uses the property &quot;surname&quot;, pass &quot;surname&quot; as the property to write to
arguments.commentblock: &lt;div class=&quot;description&quot;&gt;	&lt;ul class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;		&lt;li class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;			&lt;div class=&quot;comments&quot;&gt;&lt;!-- comment --&gt;&lt;pre&gt;Property name to look for in the relevant Class. E.g. if the JSON has a label &quot;lastName&quot; but your class uses the property &quot;surname&quot;, pass &quot;surname&quot; as the property to write to&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;			&lt;hr /&gt;		&lt;/li&gt;	&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
arguments.commenthtml: Property name to look for in the relevant Class. E.g. if the JSON has a label &quot;lastName&quot; but your class uses the property &quot;surname&quot;, pass &quot;surname&quot; as the property to write to
